reviewTitle: I like my food hot… not kinda warm..
reviewDescription: As someone always on the lookout for a reliable solution to keep my lunch warm at work, I initially gravitated toward the HOTLOGIC Electric Lunch Box. It has been a dependable choice with its straightforward warming mechanism, ideal for busy office days. Its plug-and-play nature made it easy to keep a unit at my desk, ensuring my meals are warm and ready when I need them. I also pair it with my newly purchased Lava Lunch Heated Lunch Bag for good reasons. It offers a different, innovative approach with its Lava Rock technology, which uses microwaveable heat packs to maintain toasty meals for up to 5 hours. This means no more worrying about finding an outlet, making it incredibly convenient for those who are frequently on the move. It is also crafted from non-toxic materials and features an easy-to-clean liner, which adds to its overall user-friendly design.I need a versatile and effective solution for keeping meals warm, the Lava Lunch Heated Lunch Bag delivers on all fronts. Its emphasis on ease of use and portability aligns perfectly with my lifestyle needs. Warm items go into hotlogic and HOT items go into lava lunch. Easy. If you are looking for a heated lunch solution that offers more flexibility and capacity, give both a try and see which one works best for you!

reviewTitle: HAPPY SIXTH ANNIVERSARY! Last purchased May 22, 2018
reviewDescription: I decided to write this review because I just took out yet another perfectly heated lunch and realized how much I loved this product and never shared a review. It was sheer coincidence that it's the sixth anniversary of buying this product.With out a doubt, HotLogic is one of our most RELIABLE and often used products we've EVER purchased on Amazon, this little miracle does what it does simply and perfectly, all the time, every time! I almost always bring leftovers with me to work, and the first thing I do when I get to my desk is plug in my HotLogic and zip my plastic lunch container inside. By the time lunch time rolls around I have a perfectly heated meal waiting for me! Yum! I have the mini and fell in love with it so much that I bought my wife the larger one with the included glass container.One thing that bears mentioning that often gets overlooked, is the fact that this works so much better than a microwave! Because this heats with gently from the bottom, your food will heat more evenly and still taste the way you intended it to be; delicious, hot, moist, and uniformly heated. I hated waiting in line at work to share the one messy, smelly microwave, and then have to walk back with my hot food to my office.Also, if you get an inexpensive AC adapter for your vehicle's lighter port, you can have HotLogic heating your meal as you drive. It's great for long car trips, camping, or even the drive-in!

I keep it at work and grab a frozen dinner on my way out the door. I plug it in and put my meal in it. When I'm ready to eat lunch it's nice and hot and perfect. I've used it for leftovers too! I liked it so much I bought a second one for my car to heat up breakfast while I'm at physical therapy. Best product ever!  I bought this because I really needed something to help me eat lunch everyday. It has made figuring out lunch a breeze!

reviewTitle: I am totally in love with these mini ovens! BUT, read the review and know what you're getting.
reviewDescription: First, I want to mention that it was YEARS ago when I bought my first Hot Logic Mini, and over a half decade later, it's still going strong! Since then, I've bought the "Family" size, the expandable bag style, and now this 12VDC version (and a couple backup ones for my camping gear kits).So, on to the details...WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW:- This is both a cooking "bag" oven and/or a warming plate, depending on how you use it. Yes, it will COOK food (even frozen food), unlike many of the generic "warming bags" out there.- Do NOT use meltable cheap plastics (eg: very cheap plastic bento boxes or "ziplock" style freezer/fridge bags). It does get hot enough to melt them. If you use plastic bento boxes, use high quality ones that aren't warping or bubbling in your microwave or dishwasher.- I suggest any of the high quality glass bento boxes available on Amazon for the best and widest range of cooking and heating.MY REVIEW:I bought one of these over half a decade ago, when I started my first foray into ketogenic dieting. This was back when it was really tough to find low carb meals anywhere. So, I'd prep my meals for a week or two, put them in glass bento boxes, and stick a bunch in the fridge and in the freezer. By "prep", I mean, most of the time, the stuff would be raw. I'd take them to work, stick them in the Hot Logic Mini, and plug it in 2-3 hours before lunchtime (depends on what I was eating that day - more on that later). By lunch, I'd have a hot, fully cooked meal!So far, I've found it does a really good job at cooking things like boneless chicken (chicken breasts, chicken thighs, chicken strips, etc), heating or even cooking lasagna (really nice when I make keto lasagna - the only thing I pre-cook is the ground beef so I can drain it), fish (apologies to my coworkers) and even veggies (use the 2 or 3 section glass bento boxes and put the veggies in their own section with a little bit of water for fresh, or as is for frozen, with maybe a little butter and some seasonings).I even found it can cook steak! Yes. You can actually cook totally raw (or even frozen raw) steak in it! The caveats for cooking steak are:(a) it cooks fattier steaks better (more tender)(b) it cooks it to something between a juicy tender stew meat consistency or pressure cooked and braised consistency(c) it leaves lotsa steak juices in the bento box (which helps keep the steak tender till you pull it out.So, while you're not getting a grilled steak out of it (and the steak takes a while to look the right color), what comes out is delicious. As a matter of fact, a bunch of cut up ribeye or chuck/stew meat in it, with some cut up raw carrots and potatoes, and maybe the tiniest bit of beef broth - plus a few hours to slow cook - and you're going to have a nice beef stew.I've also cooked eggs (scrambled with cheese) in them - that works out ok; something between pan fried and microwaved. It's a great time saver for weekly work food prep.It's hard to burn anything in them, which is nice. The Hot Logics just keep slowly heating the stuff, so, it is a little easier than stove cooking in that respect, that an extra hour won't destroy your food.WHAT I'VE COOKED:I've cooked bag rice (yes, the microwavable bags will survive in them, break up any rice clumps, stick them on their side, and cook for a couple hours), steak, fish, chicken, lasagna, scrambled eggs, veggies (spinach, broccoli, carrots), frozen microwavable dinners of ALL sorts, and much more.IMPROVEMENTS?Not many suggestions for this already near perfect product.- I wish they had a combo unit that was AC and DC selectable, but at the price point and small size, I'm ok if they don't.- They should integrate a velcro tie onto the cable- They should make a double height one (would be nice to put my meats on the bottom and my veggies in a glass bento box on top). I do understand why they probably won't though, because sadly I think it would confuse people who tried cooking a steak or chicken on top of something else.All in all, I now own 4 of these (was five, gave one away):- my original one, which I still use to this day- one spare for when I go on camping adventures (it only draws 40w, so, I plug it into my car's 100w inverter)- one family- one DC version (I have a Renogy battery bank that I can use to cook in tent)- one expandable one (has an expandable storage bag built onto it).I gave away the spare and moved the original into my car where it almost permanently stays, and use the expandable for work, so I can put silverware and such in the top. The DC version just came in a week ago, and will be migrating into my camping pack.NOTES:When you buy one, you will get a link to info on recipes - or you can visit their site yourself and find tons of recipes of food you can actually *COOK* in these.

Works great for what I need. I am a railroader and the Hotlogic is easy and convenient to pack in my work bag for my meals while on the engine and going down the tracks. The only thing was the lid was busted when I received it in the mail, but isn't that big of a deal.

reviewTitle: I've never been happier with a purchase!!
reviewDescription: I bought this because I really needed something to help me eat lunch everyday. It has made figuring out lunch a breeze! I keep it at work and grab a frozen dinner on my way out the door. I plug it in and put my meal in it.  When I'm ready to eat lunch it's nice and hot and perfect. I've used it for leftovers too! I liked it so much I bought a second one for my car to heat up breakfast while I'm at physical therapy.  Best product ever!

Takes much longer than a microwave, but food does not get burned and overcooked like a microwave. Takes a little planning in advance, but food goes from frozen to steaming hot (see pictures).Getting tired of eating fast food all the time while traveling, so the Hotlogic is a lifesaver for me. Great product and great results so far.

reviewTitle: I've used one so much I had to buy another one.
reviewDescription: I use this just about everyday for various meals. From frozen meals to warming up pizza to even quick quesadillas. One thing I've managed to work around is plastic baggies or plastic containers. I use them all the time for different meals and what keeps the plastic from melting is putting a paper towel on the warming plate and then the baggie/container on the towel. If you're heating up a warm sandwich, pizza, anything with bread; by occasionally flipping it over, it'll keep the bread/pizza from getting too hard to eat. If you're warming something up but don't want it too soggy, keep one side of the bag unzipped. That will air out the steam and your food won't be too soggy/wet. For quick quesadillas, just a tortilla and cheese. Clean off the warming plate and place a flour tortilla directly on the plate. Flip it over a couple of times and once the tortilla is hot enough, add cheese and fold the tortilla closed. This makes it less of a mess than if you're doing a two tortilla quesadilla. You can actually add more to the quesadilla as well. I actually cook eggs with this warmer as well as warm up frozen sausage links or patties. Once the eggs and sausage are ready, add that to the quick quesadilla and you've got a breakfast quesadilla. Or even make burritos. I cook my eggs in foil cupcake tins, just spray them with some cooking spray. It's makes for great Sausage and Egg muffins too, like at McDonalds. I even make cheeseburgers but I buy the pre-cooked burger patties and warm them up, add sliced cheese and whatever else you want and put that on a burger bun and you've got a cheeseburger. I like to keep things simple but tasty. I don't always like depending on frozen meals so being able get easy ingredients and make something in this is great. Easy clean up too. I use mine so much that I got another one just in case I might need it.

Been using this thing for a few months for work since I travel around a lot. It definitely gets food hot enough. I unusually put my stuff in about an hour before lunch and it’s always piping hot! Even if it was frozen when I put it in. Just don’t forget to unplug it when you’re done for the day or it will drain your battery, ask me how I know…

Got this for my partner because her work doesn't have enough microwaves and all 40 workers take lunch at the same time. This heater box is a lifesaver! It accepts glass and plastic containers and can even cook food - though we only use it to reheat. Just be aware you might need to vent your food periodically if you leave it plugged in for a long time. Love this and all the colors it comes in!

reviewTitle: I finally have a Portable Travel Microwave
reviewDescription: Perfect for travel, especially since more and more hotels do NOT have microwaves (?!!).What I Like:- Portability- Quick heating.  Other comments said it took a couple of hours but my food was hot in less than 90 minutes- Easy to use.  Just plug and pack your food.- Gives me a "microwave" for leftovers while traveling- Foolproof and safe- Excellent customer service.  I found it at a better price within hours and they honored it!What I Don't Like:- Container attached is small- You can't just stick anything in this.  My saran wrapped sandwich was NOT a good idea, saran wrap melted and made a mess.- Must be careful it doesn't get crushed in your luggage.  I found a bigger container and filled it to make it more rigidSUMMARY:  This is a must get for travelers. Though I have only tried it with the plastic container (not paper bag) I found it an excellent product.  Concept is easy, heating mat within an insulated bag, it does the job and safely.

reviewTitle: Worked for about a year and a half.
reviewDescription: Worked for about a year and a half.  About 3 hours a day 5 days a week as a trucker.  Than the plug started to smell and melted the plastic. Now it keeps blowing the fuse.  This is the second one because the plug on the first one broke.  It works great but has a short life.  The plastic food container that comes with it is cheap.  I use an aluminum food container which works way better.  The plug wire is long enough to keep the warmer out of the way.  Never had a problem with the zipper or warming plate.  I'll buy again.

reviewTitle: Nice idea, execution could use work
reviewDescription: The idea is nice. Not having to use a microwave, you can heat up something that's inside metal. But it takes quite a long time and by the time it's totally hot, it's dried up quite a bit.
This is good for travel on the road. My third one. I hope it lasts as long as the 1st one.
Does take a little bit of time to heat up food but overall satisfied. Only wish it had a battery operated feature when no outlets or car charger is available.

reviewTitle: Heating dish is plastic not pyrex
reviewDescription: This is a great little gadget for heating up leftovers or cooking frozen dinners.  I have never used it for cooking.  Mine is a 12v and great for camping.  Food usually heats up in a half hour.  It didn't come with a pyrex dish but a plastic one, which I do not like.  I did have a small pyrex dish with a lid of my own that Iuse instead.  These can be purchased cheaply at Hoome Goods or TJMaxx.  They used to sell these with a pyrex dish but not anymore.  Also the temperature cannot be controlled.

reviewTitle: Great way to have hot food without a microwave
reviewDescription: I don't like using a microwave and I travel a lot.  It heats slowly but very thoroughly.Must be plugged in
Works well

This thing is very easy to pack. Great for hotel rooms without microwaves. I tested mine with a thermometer and it maxed out around 140° F. Shouldn't melt plastic containers. One thing to note is that it is slow. Expect to have your food in this for at least an hour depending on how much mass is in there.

I've o ly been using it 6days a week for about three weeks now. I have no complaints besides the length of time it took to ship to me. I shouldn't complain about that either, considering the original date I was set to receive it was actually a week after I actually received it. My self and my co-workers love ours.

I bought this almost a year ago in the early part of the pandemic so I could avoid touching a bunch of surfaces in the breakroom. I have never been a fan of the communal microwave (I am a manager at a grocery store and some of the people I work with are pretty gross) but covid added a new layer of terror, and this lunchbox was a great way to deal with this.A few months later I changed positions to an admin/HR/bookkeeper role where it’s very hard to leave my little office and clock out for lunch. Someone always needs me for something or other and I have conference calls, interviews and new hires to deal with all day long. So, I decided to put this to work in a different way. My only outlets are under the desk so I plugged in one of those Christmas tree floor switches that you tap with your foot and I leave my Hot Logic plugged into that.Every day when I get there at 5 or 6am I bring in a small breakfast from home (sometimes a homemade foil-wrapped burrito, sometimes a frozen breakfast sandwich with its original plastic wrapper…) and drop it in my Hot Logic and tap it on with the foot switch. My food will be perfectly cooked whenever I can find a moment to eat an hour or three later. Then sometimes I will buy a sandwich or some cold chicken nuggets from the deli or a frozen meal from grocery and drop it in there to nosh on for lunch. It’s so handy to have my meal ready to go so I can eat anytime I have a spare moment between appointments.Also, this little lunch box works great to cook just about anything. It has never melted any plastic wrappers or boxes but somehow manages to crisp up the crust sometimes. The food is never rubbery or dried out like it gets in a microwave.My only major qualm is that the durability kind of worries me; for one thing, the little cord keeper on the side has already started coming unsewn. I hope that keeping it in my office and not actually carrying food in it will save it from wear and tear so that won’t be a problem. Like others have mentioned I do wish there was some sort of LED on this too because I’ve forgotten my food in there once or twice but I have ADHD and visual reminders are really helpful for me.

reviewTitle: Quality is good, it works as designed.
reviewDescription: Great product for every day use.

reviewTitle: If you take leftovers to work, you need this.
reviewDescription: Let me start off by saying that I use this with a container that fits perfectly inside.  The description for this container on amazon is: Pyrex Storage 6-Cup Rectangular Dish with Dark Blue Plastic Cover.  It took me a while to figure out exactly what container to use so I want to save people some time.  This container costs $6.55 on amazon at the time of my purchase.  Don't waste your money on the one with the ventilated lid, that's only useful for microwaving and costs more than double.  This oven will not pressurize the inside of your container.  Microwaves are horrible about that because they heat the water very aggressively so that some of it is boiling even when your food is cold in the middle.I plug this thing in when I get to work at 8:30am and when I eat lunch sometime after 11:00am the food is perfect.  I was concerned at first that this might overcook my food leaving it in there so long but it does not.  Today I had leftover steak, It was the ultimate test because it was one of the best I have ever cooked and the microwave I was using before always ruined steak.  It was outstanding.  You can leave your food in this thing for a long time and it will be fine.  If you are a few hours late to lunch no big deal, it will still be better than microwaving.  The secret is that it cooks your food in a sealed container with very good temperature control, trapping the moisture and odor inside.  Since it cooks gently and from the bottom you do not need to worry about your plastic lid.  The lid just doesn't get that hot.I have access to a microwave at work and I never have to wait for it, that being said, I will never use it again.  Frozen meals are excellent in this unit as well, the difference between this and a microwave is even more obvious with frozen food.In case anyone is curious about it, I did some research and found that the power consumption for the HotLogic Mini is 45 watts.  That's 0.375 amps at 120 volts.  Taking into account the efficiency loss of using an inverter, you could run 4 of these off of a standard 20 amp 12 Volt socket in a car.  I have never tested this but the math works out.Update:It's been a while and both of my units are still working perfectly.  I have been using the one I keep at work every day and I will never go back to microwaving.  Since my food is so much better now, I bring my lunch much more consistently and the savings are adding up.  When my lunch break starts I get to sit down and start eating right away, It blows my mind that my co workers can see how good this thing is and yet they still use the microwave to destroy their food.  I paid $30 each for mine and it's possible the best money I've ever spent.

reviewTitle: when you want a hot lunch but don't have access to a microwave
reviewDescription: Love it.  I didn't have to have sandwiches when I worked a 4 week assignment with no way to heat a lunch.  One of my co-workers bought one for her son who drives a truck so he could use it on the road, since it also has a cord to connect it to a cigarette lighter in the truck.  I was able to heat my lunch in about 20 minutes or sometimes less, depending on what I brought.

reviewTitle: As advertised!  Does what it's supposed to do with ease.  Compact and a joy to travel with
reviewDescription: This HotLogic Mini works great for travelling.  No more getting stuck with hotel restaurant food or granola bars.  I've heated up burritos, leftovers, frozen sandwiches, etc. on this hot plate.  The included plastic container works great, but mine eventually developed cracks in the lid.  No matter--I got some Glad 38 oz rectangular take-aways (BPA free, microwaveable) and they fit perfectly.  Not sure if the lid will handle the heat generated by my HotLogic, but it should.  The bases of the Glad containers are slightly taller than the original container, so they could be used without the lid if it seems to deform when heating.Glad Take-Aways:https://www.amazon.com/Glad-38-oz-Rectangular-Food-Container/dp/B0BF6148R2/ref=sr_1_1?crid=FKIFOCK69XFZ&keywords=glad+take+aways+38+oz+50+pieces&qid=1706559292&sprefix=glad+take-away%2Caps%2C439&sr=8-1Bravo for HotLogic for inventing this device!  I have no need for an in-room microwave anymore (apparently frowned upon by many hotels--it's a rarity for me to find a room with a microwave).  As long as I have an hour or two to heat the food, the HotLogic will do it!
Works great! I use it daily working over the road. Heats up quick.

As a truck driver I can't stand having to use the microwaves at the truck stops they are hardly ever cleaned and sometimes don't work this is a game changer I can put my food in cold or frozen or even uncooked and as I work it will cook this lets me have a a better range of options where I can stop and not have to worry about trying to find somewhere where I can heat my food up.
I pre-made meals, froze them, and then took them camping. Used this ‘stove’ to heat up the meals while I was out and about. Worked great. Takes little power to run.

I bought this for my husband and he loves it. We read the reviews so we knew the food can take a while to heat up so we prepare his food the night before or in the morning and he heats it up in this portable electric lunch box. I wish I would have gotten this for him a long time ago. I recommend.
This is the best item so far from Amazon

I have bought three Hot Logic Mini 12 volt warmers. I bought my first one several years ago on the recommendation of a friend and was very happy with the purchase. It heated my food quickly, even if it was frozen. I'm a truck driver and this was a great way to eat warm home cooked food without spending a lot of time and money at a gas station or truck stop. After several years it finally quit working so I immediately ordered another one in May of 2023. That one lasted until January of 2024 and just quit working. The light on the plug would glow but the warming tray would not heat. I decided to try one more time and ordered my third one in January of 2024. It has now quit working, and just like the last one the red light on the plug glows but the warming plate stays cold. Both of these last two warmers worked great for the short time that they worked but then just quit working after about 7 or 8 months. I'd like to try another one but I'm not sure it's going to last.
was not impressed with this warmer so send it back
No me gusto la tasa de plástico
Es demasiado pequeña
ok to begin the zipper was very hard to zip open but closing was fine and I heated up some chili that took an hour to get Luke warm so I would not buy this if your in a hurry to eat
This lasted 5 years. Now, only a small area of the heating plate works.

Great product when it was working, which is why im giving it three stars, got hot relatively quick and did a good job of keeping your food warm.My biggest issues with it is build quality, the zippers, from day one were terrible, and just got worse over time, and here we are, about a year later, and the heating element is broken.At 40ish bucks, I dont think its worth it.

Its a good idea. It works for me because it keeps food warm for hours. And the food taste much better than getting nuked in the microwave. My complaints are as follows - Food gets soggy. Since all of the food is effectively in the same oven (sealed dish) it all gets cooked at the same temperature. The heating plate somehow senses when the food inside needs to be cooked and it cooks for a period of time before reducing temperature to hold at warm. There is no way for it to know that some food should be cooked shorter and some longer and it would not matter anyways since there is only one heating element and one dish. The end result is as the manufacturer claims - the food will never be overcooked - but that depends on your definition of overcook (like asking Slick-Willy-Clinton what the definition of "is" is. Rarely will food ever dry out (sweet potatoes will if you leave them in there for 10 hours by themselves.) But once the cooking is complete the temperature lowers to keep the food warm indefinitely but all of that moisture in the sealed dish will cause vegetables to become soggy, and meats to become more and more tender. So really meat and fish can remain in for 10 hours and they are fine. Vegetables will be soggy after just a few hours depending on the type of vegetable. I purchased two of these ovens and they are plugged in 10 hours/day. The meat and fish are plug and play and I can eat from them whenever I want, though they do become more and more tender and will fall apart easier as they day goes on. The vegetables need more attention and are best only left in there 2-3 hours and then replenished for the next meal, otherwise they will become wilted and soggy. Cooking vegetables like brussel sprouts is confusing - they can be in there for 8 hours and be barely tender enough to eat, yet after just two hours they are wilted and "grey" looking inside and out. Peas will wilt. Broccoli will wilt very quickly. Red peppers if not eaten in three hours will turn to mush. A little disappointing. My second complaint is the heating process - the manufacturer recommends keeping food in contact with the bottom of the bowl. This limits the usefulness of the oven. The manufacturer recommends a 6-cup pyrex container. If you limit the food to the amount that can touch the bottom of the container than you really cant carry that much food. Apparently the food gets cooked thru the surface to surface contact on the bottom. Any food not actually making contact with the bottom will get cooked but takes significantly longer. I pre-cook all meat so if I layer a second layer of meat, it will get heated properly just takes longer than the bottom later and not as hot. If I layer a second layer of raw vegetables, the cooking takes much much longer for the top layer since only the bottom layer will really "cook." And does that second level actually cook or do they just get soggy? Maybe a little of both. One last comment - because of the heating technology used which admittedly I really don't understand, once the dish is opened and food removed, the food taken from the bottom of the dish is really really hot, but it gets cold really really fast. So if you insist on a hot meal like I do be prepared to eat fast otherwise you'll be making trips to the microwave. As i said earlier, its a good idea.

I wanted to love this. I am a flight attendant and most hotels do not have microwaves in the room, so this was going to be the answer for me...or so I thought. Getting in close to midnight or later and being hungry...it takes FOREVER to heat my food. When I get to my hotel room, I am ready to relax, unwind and eat but I ended up waiting so long that I fall asleep. Again, I wanted to love it, but I do not.
Product says it’s 12v and it is not. You need a 110 inverter to run it. Instructions even say 12v and it has a 110v plug. It works good on 110v but is not as advertised.

I visit my husband who is in a memory care facility from morning till night and I was spending lots of money buying food every day for me. Now I can bring my leftovers to his facility and use this product to heat up my food. It works great is compact and sturdy. It is a wonderful product and I wish I would have thought of this outstanding idea.
Muy bueno
This is my 4/5 purchase of the hot logic. Buying as gifts because they are so useful. Highly recommend these to anybody wanting to cook, reheat or anything in-between.

love it! use  it multipole times a day! only warning is the heating element is not sealed so don't spill any thing on it, also zippers I pulled the little goodie off but was able to reinstall so carful with zipping. other than that great product!
Toma su tiempo pero calienta muy bien
My son heats his hamburgers in his truck when on the road. Works great!
Plug in, treat like a slow cooker. No sound no microwaves. Perfect.

reviewTitle: It works better than I thought it would
reviewDescription: Provided you have a always hot 12v plug it works great for lunches. Takes more time than the manufacturer says but works well for my timing.

reviewTitle: Hot meal anywhere you want it.
reviewDescription: I absolutely love this product! I'm a truck driver and used to buy most of my meals from truck stops because I wanted a hot meal instead of a cold sandwich or something similar. Now I just meal-prep something at home and enjoy a nice hot meal while on the road! I like it more than a microwave because it heats everything all the way through. Now, it does take longer than a microwave, but if you have the time, it's so much better.

reviewTitle: Great for work & not having to wait in line for microwave
reviewDescription: This is my 3rd one. I use one regularly at work to avoid having to use the microwave for my lunches. I’ve lent one to my parents for reheating the frozen meals that I prep for them. …And this one is for me to use at home. I think they are easy to use, healthier than the microwave, and great for using with a battery pack either during a power outage or on a trip.

The moment this product arrived I thought this was saved me some money and one of my food quick but I've done 3 testing in and I am extremely disappointed. I thought it would easily wipe my food quick. But it just takes way too long and is way too time consuming.  I tested with 3 different containers. The first container was just like a Had a full amount of food in it and when I warm it. I thought it took like 30 to 40 minutes. No, it took 2 hours and 2 minutes to warm up the food in a good hot temperature tested it with a second container I used a small one with a decent amount of foods. Warm it up that took 1 hour and 35 minutes In the last third container was a glass container and after I tested that that took over 3 hours to warm up the food It works don't get me wrong. But the biggest con with this product is that it is way too time consuming, especially that's those that's on a Go like at work or something. So I personally do not recommend this product at all. If you're someone, that's needs to bring a lunch to work.  And there's a no microwave or something.And you gonna use this, don't use it. It takes like hours to warm up your food By the time your food is warm up enough your break is over. I suggest finding like a different type of electric lunch boxnot this one My only advice for the ones that made this product.  Increase the heat so the food quicker.

I’m a local intermodal truck driver who works out in the morning and meal preps 2 meals a day for the entire week while at work following my 16 fast. I’ve taken care of it as it’s been great! A lot of these shippers don’t even have restrooms let alone somewhere you can warm up food or even get past the caged area past the S/R door. Followed the instructions heat it up on its own for 15-20 minute then place your food inside and in an hour boom it’s hot and ready to eat. I noticed that hot and ready temp being the first to go when my food wasn’t as hot and then one day plugged it up and nothing! Didn’t heat up at all. Purchased in Jan and died beginning of this month Jul so 6 months was all I got at 2 meals a day. So maybe if you do 1 you can get a year out of it? Definitely a bummer.

(EDIT) This product works as it should.One thing I wish i would have known before purchasing is that it would take an hour to heat up my food.I cook about 400-600g of food and that's in each meal prep container.I heat it up in a very cold state, not frozen, just cold.I never really stir it up, just shake it in the container after about 45 mins.______________EDIT:So I've had this product for about a month or so, and recently it just stopped working entirely.The light indicator turns on when plugged in but the heat pad wont heat at all.It's not the 12 volt socket because i can charge my phone there just fine.I visually inspected everything and it looks completely fine. Don't know whats wrong with it, it just stopped working.
It will take you about 1.5-2 hrs to heat up a container of soup.  I tried it 2 days in a row, you are better off driving and microwaving it at a local deli and making it back to the job on time.

reviewTitle: A must have for a company driver
reviewDescription: I am a local truck driver, and this is a must have! I I was recommended it by a few  friends of mine to get this. I got it and I’m not disappointed there’s many different versions, but this is the best !! Makes your food hot like it was just cooked on the stove! Worth themoney and saves you from eating unhealthy and spending by eating outOk update very upset it stop working keep in mind I use about twice a week give or take. I tried to reach out to Amazon or hot logic, but got no response. I should’ve just bought a microwave or cheaper one if it was only last us long. Not good I’m out on $40.

Serious and dangerous flaws. I tested the HotLogic on two separate frozen Marie Calendars dinners. The first one, I plugged in at 8:00 A.M. and checked it at 11:00 A.M.. I opened the zippered bag a saw the contents of the dinner rapidly boiling and the plastic film bulging out. The temperature on my laser thermometer read 215 deg. F on the package film covering. The contents were overcooked, unrecognizable and inedible. I tried a second dinner and timed it for only two hours with pretty much the same results. The problem with this particular unit is that it had no temperature regulation and would not maintain a constant temperature (like a slow cooker). Did I get a defective unit? I was surprised, because most of the one star reviews were because the unit didn't get hot enough or just stopped working.I think that the HotLogic is a great idea having serious flaws that need correcting. $40.00 is too much money for a cheap zippered lunch bag with an unregulated temperature "hot plate." I expected nothing of the HotLogic except a warm meal after a few hours, but it just couldn't deliver. No more ruined meals for me. I just returned it.Note: I rarely leave one star reviews. This unit just might have been defective. Don't let this review keep you from trying one out. You might get one that works.
Stop working with in 30 days of the purchase
Product appeared smaller than I expected. However, when I opened it, it was already used. The product was oily, and had pieces of food left inside. Please see photos. Definitely returning this item!
Muy pequeño, solo tiene un compartimento y es demasiado sencillo y muy caro.

reviewTitle: Second hot logic. Both stopped working
reviewDescription: This is my second 12V Hot Logic. Both stopped working. Plug is illuminated, but hot plate stays cold. I work as a first responder and rely on the hot logic to heat my food. I will not recommend this product to my coworkers anymore.

Got this for my hubs who is a truck driver. He doesn’t always have access to microwave.  It took about an hour to heat his food while he was driving and was able to have home cooked meal on the road.  He likes it.
Calienta mi comida muy bien. Ahora no tengo que comer frío en mi trabajo como conductor de vehículos.
Takes about 30 minutes to heat up food in a Pyrex container. Gets Hot.  Great for traveling.

I use the standard plug in type all the time for heating leftovers or side dishes. I bought this with a power cord converter for travel and/or as a second meal heater. If you haven't tried one before they take about an hour to heat up a refrigerated meal and two hours to heat a frozen dinner. Great for work as it keeps smells mostly contained.

reviewTitle: Most convenient and now lunch tastes better.
reviewDescription: I bought this about a year and a half ago and I use it a lot.  I even bought another to have in reserve in case this one should meet an untimely demise.  You do need to evaluate the time needed to heat what you are cooking, but that doesn't take much trial and error.  Most things I've heated can stand to sit in the heat for an hour or two longer than is really necessary, if it should come to that.  Many things I heat for lunch taste better in my Hot Logic than coming out of a microwave oven.  A frozen solid lasagna requires for me to plug it in as soon as I get to the office, but then it comes out really good.  Rice with some chicken, veggies, and spices requires me to set an alarm on my phone to remind me to plug it in about an hour or two before lunch.  I bought it for the convenience of not using our break-room microwave, the food tasking better is a very welcome bonus.

reviewTitle: Best purchase to save me money and eat healthy!!
reviewDescription: *****************************************update 11/14/2016******************************************************This unit still works great!! I have purchased a second unit! I will tell you frozen dinners taste so much better from the mini oven than the micro wave! They come out smoother and better tasting... This product continues to heat my food and makes for a better day for me while I am at work.*****************************************original review below**********************************************************************************************This is working out so great!! I take this to work with me and to workshops!!! No more using nasty community microwaves or standing in line for the microwave!! I love this item!!Saves me money and keeps me away from the nasty microwave and nasty cafeteria! I was so tired of the long lines and attitudes at the community work microwave!!! I was tired of the nasty cafeteria food and wanted a way to heat my food instead of always taking sandwiches as an alternative! I saw this mini portable oven when it was around $39.00. Which has already paid for itself at first I thought the price was too high.The straw that broke me down was when I was in a workshop and the one micro wave that was there went out after a person had used it and left me having to eat cold food!!! I said never again, as soon as I made it home I ordered this and the on the go cereal bowl and salad unit! Working for someone else is hard as it is!!! So I said never again will I be in a position that I have to eat cold food or use a nasty micro wave that is unhealthy!!! Or pay for nasty food, that may not have even been prepared correctly!So far this unit has paid for its self, I have ate chicken, and rice, spaghetti, soups, sausage green bean potatoes, and many more! I cook in my bigger crock pots so dinner is done when I arrive home, so I take a portion of that meal and place it in the glass Pyrex ware for my lunch for the next day and what a pleasant treat for me knowing I have healthy food warming and in a clean unit!!!Someone told me that it smelled good in my work space I just said thanks because I did not want them running and telling, you know how some people can mess things up for others. (Yes, that is the type of work environment I currently have) So this unit makes my day pleasant knowing I have a great lunch waiting for me!!!I am so happy with this unit that I plan to purchase an adapter for our suv so that if I need to heat food up in the suv I can if I am out in workshops and there are no plugs etc (things do happen).I highly recommend this unit! For me it blesses my day because it gives me more time to also read my bible during my lunch instead of waiting in line to purchase food or heat my food. I make sure I always have something to heat in my portable oven even if it is just a can of soup! I refuse to go back to the micro wave or cafeteria!I don't have to stand in line any or more or watch the attitudes of people waiting for the microwave or using the microwave. I am grateful, for my current environment, just speaking on how much of a blessing this unit has been for me!Peace of mind!!!! Gives me more time to also eat the word for lunch!!
Muy buen produto muy util para mi esposo que trabaja de camionero
My husband loves this thing. Works and warms up his meals while working. He works for the railway so I did have to buy an adapter from eBay in order to plug in on the train.

reviewTitle: 12V: Perfect for Working Out of a Car
reviewDescription: I work as an environmental scientist and I primarily work in remote areas. Even if I wanted to buy lunch everyday, I usually don't have the opportunity. I've gotten tired over of the years of cold sandwiches & salads. With this food warmer, I can have a hot lunch everyday which is especially nice in the winter when I am working outside and freezing cold. I've never tried to heat anything from frozen but heating a refrigerated meal only takes 20-30 minutes. It will get your food piping hot. I highly recommend this if you work out of a vehicle. I've had it for about 5 months now and so far, so good.
Muy bueno

reviewTitle: Too short and plate a bit too small
reviewDescription: Had to exchange it because it was very shallow, also a few inches bigger plate would be way better, but the next size up is a huge casserole size. I wish the sizing on their products were better.  Also the zipper was super flimsy and it was hard to zip up, it seemed as if it were gonna fall apart tomorrow.
Got this because a co worker has one, I thought it would come with dishes for the inside to reuse, but it didnt, and I don't have that size

I love it, but the only draw back is the size. I like to eat a lot but I'm limited to what containers fit in this thing. I had to purchase new ones just to use it. If it was an inch or 2 taller it would be perfect. Also, you have to carry an extra lunch bag for work because the only thing fitting in here is your warm meal, not your drink, snack, fruit, or whatever else. My plastic fitpacker brand meal prep container only leaves an inch of room on one side.Note: I was going to order on their site originally to get their package that comes with 2 minis and a joining tray for 80 bucks, but had a terrible experience with their customer service so I ordered through Amazon whom I trust.

reviewTitle: Not sure it works as it claims.
reviewDescription: I purchased this item as a Christmas gift for my son. He’s used it twice at work and has not been able to get it to fully warm his food.

reviewTitle: Works, but takes like an hour
reviewDescription: It’s smaller than I thought, and works enough. It takes about an hour to heat up my food, it does get hot though.

reviewTitle: did not get hot enough for me
reviewDescription: I liked that it was small. you could put most anything in it to warm...unfortunately it took too long to heat things for me..Do not attempt heating anything from frozen.. it takes several hours.. defeating my purpose of freezing meals ahead of time.. I would have to defrost over night before trying to heat them up..Leftovers were fine as if you used a tight closed container.. I loved that you didn't need to watch over them..just plug it in and a few hours later they were warm...I got use to another brand that got hotter,,,.. odd thing is this one keep popping off more than the other one I had been using and not coming back on...

reviewTitle: start heating at breakfast to eat hot food for lunch
reviewDescription: I like the idea but it takes much longer than they say to warm a couple bean burritos.  I had to leave it run 4 hours to make warm but not hot for items which were cold from the cooler.  Which makes it less convenient than the 2 or 3 hours I believe I remember being lead to believe.  Don't take it internationally as they held me up for an hour in security before letting me through I really thought they would take it away from me.  So far I have had only a few questions from security here but most of the time they serve my bag if I  am carrying this item.

reviewTitle: Help My hot logic won’t turn on
reviewDescription: It won’t turn on

I’ve had my hot logic for 2 months now and it just now stopped working. I use it 3-4 times a week heating one meal. And today was the day it decided not to heat properly. And the usual 50 minutes it would take to heat my food took way longer, so I just ate my food half way warm. When I first started using it. It heated my food fast and properly. Pizza came out soggy and everything else like chicken, rice and veggies turned out perfect. The size and design were perfect for my pyrex glass dishes and even plastic tub-aware. Stores easy in my backpack. And just perfect for my on the go job.

Giving three stars since the packaging clearly isn’t great. Container arrived broken, hopefully nothing else is. Don’t have time to return since my boyfriend leaves tomorrow for the week and needs this for his food. Will update on how the rest of it works.

For the price I was expecting a lot more for the money & thought how it looked like it was made out of reflectix with a tiny little conduction plate. After I opened my package I couldn’t believe how flimsy it was. If I paid 9 $ less I could have gotten a heated lunchbox with a metal container with the heat element built in & an additional metal insertable container, lockable cover, two power cords, 1 12 v & 1 110 cord in addition, metal eating utensils included. This hotligic came with a thin little disposable type container u would get for take out from a Chinese restaurant. I haven’t plugged it in or tried it yet but I definitely won’t use the container. I believe the container would leak inside the lunch pouch. I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.What’s more, the container was crushed under the pressure of being pushed into the mailbox
I've purchased two (thinking the first one that quit working was just bad luck) the second just lasted a few days past 30 days. Great concept but the product just isn't there yet.

I misunderstood the type of container.  It came with a cheap plastic container rather than a glass dish with a secure lid, as shown in pictures provided in the reviews.  I am hopeful that it is still a useful product, but I am disappointed with the container for this price point.
Bought this to use occasionally and today when I'm zipping it up the zipper snaps in half. Lol

reviewTitle: The heating element works great, but the bag isn't durable
reviewDescription: 2 stars for the efficacy of the heating element - it really does work, and it's such a great invention.But the bag, the part that houses the whole thing and enables it to be portable and self-contained, is crap. To be fair, I purchased this several years ago, but also to be fair, it seen literally less than 5 uses in that whole time and the seam on the bag has a hole in it. My original intention for this was to send lunch to work with my fiancee, who is in his truck all day. Unfortunately, he didn't think it was nearly as good of an idea as I did, and so it sat in its box, totally unused, for almost 2 years until I remembered I had it, and it was too late to send it back.I used it once on a vacation where I knew I would be getting an insanely large steak dinner (go to Jocko's, if you're ever in the San Luis Obispo area!) and was staying in a place without a microwave. I used it 3 times when my mom had an accident and wanted hot food pre-prepared for her so she didn't have to hobble around the house. And just this last week, I used it once to bring my food to work for lunch.So, yeah. That's not a lot of uses, and definitely not a lot of zipping and unzipping, and really, it was only 4 times because on the 5th time is when I saw the hole. Nothing very heavy has ever been held inside, and it was only held by the handle those few times it was used. For $40, I would've hoped that the bag would be more durable than it has proven to be. Still, the heating element works, and heats food well. I wonder if replacement bags exist out there.

reviewTitle: Good heat but it doesn’t hold up
reviewDescription: I’m on my second hot logic lunch box in 12 months and it’s starting to fall apart again. It works great for heating up my food but it’s cheaply made. My first lunchbox lasted about 4 months and the charger fell apart. This one I’ve had about 7 months and the zipper is falling apart now

reviewTitle: Quality has severely declined. Very flimsy and cheap feeling
reviewDescription: Short version: This was a huge disappointment. I immediately returned it after receiving and assessing it. This item was severly lacking in quality.I am an EMT and was so excited to get this after seeing one of my partners with one.  He bought his 5 years ago and had nothing but great things to say about it. The lunchbox itself was good quality, nice and sturdy like any regular lunch box you'd buy. The food container inside was also a good quality reusable food container one would reasonably pack daily lunch in with flaps to seal it.The item I received was absolutely poo. It's the thickness and sturdiness of a free throwaway lunchbox you'd get as a promotional item. I would never pay more than a dollar or 2 for a lunchbox so cheap. I wouldn't even be comfortable washing the inside for fear it'd fall apart.The heating element is the only thing that feels sturdy but after seeing the quality and "care" of the rest of this item, I don't trust it to last.Lastly, they have the nerve and disrespect to include a **disposable** takeaway container as a "free gift". Mine came cracked and I'd rather it wasn't included at all.

reviewTitle: Don't buy---breaks before it's a month old!!!
reviewDescription: Purchased on 4-1-2024 and today, 4-29-2024......Needs to be replaced and if that's not in the cards, will purchase another...Had such high hopes this would be great.....Nope folks, it sucks!

reviewTitle: Silent, easy to use, but faulty wiring — doesnt last long for the price
reviewDescription: Loved these, but they don’t last long. I think the wiring inside is cheap or not fastened properly, because after months of steady use only on a flat surface, one suddenly failed, smelled of burnt wires in spite of gentle use and regular care. And we have had to return others for the same reason. Also, the corners aren’t shaped properly and catch in the zipper unless you fiddle them. And a family member had a long list of ways she fiddled with timing and other details to keep meat from going rubbery while veggies and purees separated into water and mush after more than the recommended minimum reheat time. Example, rice, even premade in pouches, will scorch unless you add water and stir, or flip the premade pouch, every half hour. Looking into other brands.

Worked great for 19 days beyond the 90 warranty period of 90 days, then stopped heating completely. The red light on the plug turns on when connected, but the heating plate no longer gets warm. Will not purchase another. Not Wirth the money fir such a short usable time period.
It worked  will cycle 30/45/ 90 days. TBD

reviewTitle: Works great but could be designed more user friendly.
reviewDescription: It works really well for heating food and keeping it warm. I would have given it 5 stars if there was an easier way to remove the Pyrex 6 cup glass dish it came with without burning my hands. It is such a perfect fit that the first time I used it I burned my fingers on the glass and then on the steam when the lid popped off while I was trying to lift it out the dish. Now I either unplug it and let it sit opened for a few minutes or I just keep the dish in the mini oven while I'm eating from it. I also wish it had an outside zipper or some place to store silverware. I haven't tried storing metal silverware in the oven for fear of burning my fingers.

I purchase 2 of these for my truck driver husband.  They last about 12-16 months and then stop working. Each time my husband was on the road and couldn't eat lunch. Hes also diabetic. So disappointing.  I think I'll try another brand.

The slow heat personal oven is not a bad idea but there are some design flaws and in my opinion, the product is also poorly constructed. To begin with, it lacks a on/off switch therefore the only way to turn it on or off is to plug and unplug the power, this is kind of clumsy.Secondly, there is no temperature control. Once the container of food reached the desired temperature, the oven cannot be turned down to prevent the food from overcooked. For that reason, if green veggies are left for too long, they will turn brown.Finally the case is really low quality. It is very flimsy and insulation is next to nothing.
My husband works outside and doesn’t have access to warm up his lunch. I purchased this and It worked great till it quit working after a couple of months.
I wish it had both adapters but I still like it, I have alot of my coworkers buying some now

I love my hot logic min, it’s one of the best purchases I’ve ever made for heating food. I use mine when I go fishing. I just plug it into my trucks cigarette lighter and I have a warm entrée in just about 25 minutes. If you are going on vacation or you travel for a living there are two different types of minis one is for the car charger, the other is for an electrical plug (I own them both) I have used them both and they both heat food very well. This  little item is well worth the money
The heater worked well. Works a lot better than a microwave. I would suggest another brand tho the zipper broke the 2nd time using it.
Actually super awesome, didn’t give it 5 stars because the container arrived broken

I expected a new item. This arrived in a plastic bag, the carrying strap with a rubber band around it and the tote interior was crumpled.  It should have been stated that was return and discounted.I am not returning it because it is inconvenient to do so at this time.  But I am not a happy customer

This little oven is a good purchase for keeping food warm and for warming food.  Not Styrofoam friendly. It is excellent with take out plastic dishes and glass.  I've had it a few months and I don't have any complaints, yet.

I was looking for a microwave on the go and thought this may be a solution for me. It stated in the description possible length of time. Thought this would be convenient for us, but it takes way too long to heat for that. Great thought, super quick delivery, but don't meet my needs. I do think if you are using this for a job, then it would work, but I was attempting to use these for my Summer Camp kids when out and about. I think the time will seem like an eternity when wanting to feed little kids, unless you can truly plug it and forget it for several hours. I think maybe in a jam it would also be a good option or maybe while traveling in a car if it is one person taking up one cigarette lighter or if you are camping out in the woods and have no other source. For me, it would be far quicker and more convenient to just go and pick up food. This is no slight on the company or even the product, just a review of how I feel it would meet some person's needs and why it didn't meet mine. They came just wrapped in thin plastic, but it did have all the instructions inside, a container for you to warm your food in, and it was sturdy as well as cute looking.

reviewTitle: Smaller than imagined, does the job, is a bit slow
reviewDescription: You can never fully trust measurements or sizing on Amazon depending on the seller or product in general, but this did come in a bit smaller than I had imagined.Still, you can fit what you need in there. A burger and fries should fit just fine.It does take a good bit of time to heat up, but listen... we're working with car plug-ins. What can you really expect?No real complaints here, just being honest as it may not be exactly what you want, but it works for my boyfriend while on call and he loves it.It comes with a plastic insert, but you may want to switch it out. Insert is easy to clean, we just toss it in with our dishes if need be. Have never had any consistency issues, still works like new after a few months.Overall 4/5 for sizing and wait time, but a great product for on the go!
Delivered as advertised.I do wish it had a 110v plug as well.Handy product, though.  I work in the field all day, in a company truck.  Great for my situation.

This thing works well. I drive truck so I plug it in a few hours before I want to eat. It will cook your food, not just heat it up. My only regret is that I didn't get the bigger size. The zipper snags a little bit. There is no setting so it's up to you to unplug it when you think food is hot.

reviewTitle: Pretty happy with it. Here's what I've discovered...
reviewDescription: Overall, I'm pretty happy with my purchase. I chose to go with this brand because of the extensive online reviews everywhere and a "feeling" this may be a better choice than the cheaper brands and perhaps not cause a fire when it's out of sight. Basically it does what it says so I won't waste time going into everything already covered elsewhere.Here's what I've discovered that new buyers MIGHT find helpful. The obvious question... How do I know how long to heat my frozen entree when I'm just starting out?Answer: Look at the microwave instructions! Assume the average microwave is 1100 watts and then multiply the time by 27. Why 27??? Because 1100/40 watts is 27.5... Meaning it will take the 40 watt heating element 27 times longer to consume the same amount of energy as the microwave. So if your entree says microwave it for 3 minutes... try about 80 minutes (or less to be safe).Is this fool proof??? Absolutely not, it's called a rule of thumb and you can adjust it from there as you gain experience. No 2 foods will reheat the same but at least the frozen entree people gave us a clue as to how much energy they think we should pump into their creation to bring it back to life.Does it work for refrigerated leftovers, you ask??? Sure, except YOU must come up with a microwave time and power setting YOU would normally use to reheat leftovers. 3 mins at 50% power???50% power = (1100/2) = 550550/40 = 13.75x 3 mins you'd normally reheat= 41.25 mins in the miniThere're multiple ways to do the math. Just imagine you're throwing watts into a bowl for a certain period of time and then ask yourself how many minutes it would take if you only throw 40 watts per minute into the bowl instead of 1100.I hope that's not too confusing and that someone is helped by it.

*** Update below - originally 1 star *** I will NOT be returning these (I have two), but I do NOT recommend them right now. I so much wanted to love this item, but I don't. I have tried on several occasions to heat frozen meals in the car and was unsuccessful at all attempts. It takes FAR longer than 2 hours for food to even get warm, let alone hot. I have both types of oven--AC and 12V. I've plugged the one directly into the AC charger in the car and the other I've plugged into a 120V inverter (w/480W capacity), but neither of them worked well. So far, REALLY, REALLY disappointed. I say "so far" because I've only tried them while idling the engine (yes, for HOURS at a time). I'm going on another 5+ hour road trip in a week and I'm going to test them while driving to see if that makes a difference (although I can't imagine how or why it would, but we'll see), then update this review to confirm or change my rating.*** UPDATE ***First, since this thing doesn't come w/precise instruction, you have to figure it out. I found out that it works best if you PREHEAT IT, just like a a regular oven. All that requires is plugging it in for about 20mins and it gets quite warm. Second, it still takes more than an hour for frozen foods, but for things like RediRice or canned goods it works fairly well (about 40 mins including preheat). While those foods feel really hot in the package, it tends to be just really warm, certainly edible. I've also heated plastic bottles of water for instant coffee; again, feels hot, but just really warm. And I make popcorn! After preheating, I put a bag in and it starts to pop after about 5 mins. After another 5 mins, I unzip the oven and continue to cook until the bag is fully expanded. 😊

reviewTitle: It’s all good just like I said, wish it had the glass container still
reviewDescription: Like this product just wish it came with the glass container like it used to. now it comes with a plastic . that’s the reason I gave it four stars.

My husband travels a lot and takes dinners to hotels which sometimes doesn’t microwaves in the room.It takes a little while to warm up but he usually turns it on as soon as he settles in the room and is done by the time he’s finished showering.Very handy when he’s on the road and folds up nicely.

reviewTitle: A "must have" item for minivan steath camping
reviewDescription: The Hot Logic Mini is basically a small hot-plate inside an insulated-aluminized lunch bag. We had just started minivan stealth camping and needed a low wattage cooking appliance to complement our existing our 550 Watt portable power station and mini fridge. Since we were planning on eating out each day we only needed something to heat up any leftovers. The Hot Logi Mini, with its ability to take a standard 1.5 Quart square Pyrex Dish met this need perfectly. It performed exactly as advertised. Plugged in it used only 50 Watts. The only inconvenience is having to remember to load and plug in the Hot Logic Mini at least 2 hours in advance of your planned meal. So we'd load and plug in the Hot Logic Mini right after breakfast so that it could heat the food while were on the road. By lunchtime the food would always be piping hot. We've upgraded to a larger power station and bought a butane stove in preparation for our next road trip.  However because of its small footprint and efficient use of energy the Hot Logic Mini is also coming along for the ride.

reviewTitle: It was great while it lasted.
reviewDescription: I bought this in June for my husband who is a truck driver, so he could heat up his lunch. So many places he delivered to did not allow him to use their microwave to warm up his lunch during this pandemic. And today, it stopped working. It no longer heats up.
Simply ok. Takes to long to warm meal. About 2 hrs form my lunches.

I loved it right up until it stopped working for no apparent reason. It worked great for 2 months, pulled my lunch out of it today and my food was ice cold, just the way I don’t like it.😩. Maybe I just got a defective one. Lunch time was so nice for two month.

reviewTitle: Works good but takes a while to heat up food
reviewDescription: A lot of my coworkers use these and other branded food warmers and for some reason this one takes a lot longer to heat up food then the other brands, for a regular size lunch it takes about an hour to heat up wich isn’t a huge deal just hoped it would work a little better than that

IT'S A HOTTIE 👍Literally a hot product baking on the market right 👉 now. I fell in luv with this teeny tiny oven, after getting over the shock of it's tininess. Bought it, to take with me on my vacation, but started using it, now I can't stop. I've cook some of, everything in this little sucka. Pizza, Hot Pockets, Hungry Man Dinners, Frozen Dinners, Baked Chicken, you think of it, I went there. Definitely will be puttin my order in for at least a few more. It's hottt...YES

reviewTitle: Thought it came with indoor charger
reviewDescription: I thought it came with in indoor light switch charger
Takes forever to heat up the food but it does get warm.
Just received my hotlogic. Was very disappointed to find the food container that it comes with was broken. Hopefully this is the only thing wrong with it
Bought as a  gift

reviewTitle: It also would had been nice if it was just a few inches wider & ...
reviewDescription: It’s a very neat item. It really does the job but it takes too long. An outdoor worker uses the one I bought and when its cold outside, waiting for a meal to warm up is an essence much more waiting for it to get hot! He likes the product, but the inconvenience to use the cigarette lighter while the truck is off site or find an electric outlet is a hassle specially when there is no electric on site. It also would had been nice if it was just a few inches wider & taller.

Great idea. Poorly made. Was in love when I first came across this product. Once I received mine, I was disappointed. Doesn’t heat food evenly, let’s heat escape where the cord runs from the plug to inside to the hot plate, and the plug in is very cheaply made. My plug fell apart. No damage to it, wasn’t rough with it nothing. And I had just used it before it came apart. Wouldn’t pay $40 for this. Maybe $20, but for $40 you should be getting a better product than this.

reviewTitle: Hot logic needs sturdier plug designs for vehicles
reviewDescription: This is my third hot logic bag and this is the first one that I must complain about. I have the model that you can plug in at home and I had an older model that can plug into the car but it had a different plug design than the new model. The old model that plugs into the vehicle had its plug crack on me where the plug screwed together, but continued to work. This new plug design has melted and burned my hand.
Looking forward to using this new product opened the package and the first thing I see is the plastic container it comes with damaged. I’m hoping it works great.

reviewTitle: takes to long, may be defective
reviewDescription: I like the concept, i live in hotels so anything i can cook in thats less likely to get me thrown out is a plus. But I wonder if I've gotten a defective unit. Seems like its taking to long to heat up. Raw thawed meat took like 4+hours and still had some pink. Hour n a half reheating a refidgerated left over burrito and still had coldness. Trying a frozen burrito and sandwich right now, the top of the container is still cold and has been an hour n a half. At this point i can only imagine using it to keep already warm foods warm...
The portable oven itself is fine. This is the second one I’ve bought this year. The Tupperware that came with this one was damaged. Going to have to use my own instead. Would not buy again.
The product heats up well, but the bag is tearing apart. I think they need to invest in a little better material.

This lunch bag had my hubby so happy. He was finally able to have hot lunches without having to buy fast food. He works on the railroad so no place to have hot food unless you buy fast food since not much time for lunch. Unfortunately, it stop working after one week. Very disappointing and I was gonna buy one for my son that’s a truck driver. Glad I didn’t waste my money.

reviewTitle: Plug broke in a few days using it
reviewDescription: I like the way it warm up, but it’s too fragile broke in a few days, I don’t know how to be honest, it’s just missing the plug connector.
Loved this until the socket portion that goes into the car lighter broke. You cannot simply replace the cord since it’s built into the baseplate. Wish it was more durable.

5 star for the first 6 months1 star after that.Used maybe 1-3 times a week 1-3 hours at a time. One day I started smelling a burning plastic smell when I checked the hot logic I noticed it was extremely hot. Alot hotter than normal. Looking at it I noticed it was shriveled up.  I'm not sure what happened but it was nice when it worked. Probably not getting another one.

This product is sturdy with a handle that makes it easy to carry and a four foot cord that facilitates being able to place it in the most convenient area during use. It also comes with a plastic container and lid to use for your warming and cooking needs. However, it would be nice if there was an indicator light to verify that the unit is on at a glance.When it arrived, I cut up and seasoned some raw potatoes and onions to see how long it would take them to cook. It took 5 hours and 45 minutes. When I choose to cook potatoes again, I will slice them thinner to reduce the cooking time. I have not warmed up any leftovers yet but judging how hot the unit got while the potatoes were cooking it should have no issues warming.So far I am very satisfied.
It does take quite a while to heat up my food but if you start heating it like an hour or two before lunch it works perfect. I’m a truck driver so I’m fine with that. 4/5 stars

Only reason for 4 stars is because packaging is a a little lame, came wrapped as as you see it, maybe a box next time??  But product is good, last one I bought was a different brand and did not last long hopefully this one gives me at least a year of service

Very light weight and convenient. Takes about 90 minutes to properly heat my food in the size container that comes with it but i mostly do 2 hours. Works well when I have a busy schedule the food heat while I work and when I am ready i just enjoy.It is best to heat it in the bag as the bag protect the temperature as it heats up

I bought this for use in my Transit Connect micro car camper, which is so small I am leery of using a gas stove inside. I've been testing it in my sticks and bricks first and it works great for cooking small pieces of meat (I made delicious salmon with a cabbage veggie mixture and warmed up precooked rice yesterday), overnight oats, etc.Note that you really CANNOT bake in this. Nor can you cook hard things like raw rice, pasta, potatoes, carrots, etc. It doesn't get hot enough, but the manufacturer tells you that upfront. However you can slow cook meat, tofu, frozen dinners, and other things and they come out great.Note that I bought the 110 version, because the 12 volt was out of stock. I am going to test it on my Bluetti solar power bank later this week but I don't anticipate running my battery down.It will be great to be able to prep and pop a simple meal in there on the morning of a driving day, and have a hot lunch or dinner when I stop.

reviewTitle: Great little lunch warmer but the price has gone up!!! From 9.99 to 39.99
reviewDescription: I have this lunch warmer for over a year and has suited me very well. I work in construction and i dont always have time or most of the time i cant afford to stop my work and find a place to get lunch. I have deadlines i must meet. So its best ti bring your lunch. Its always better to bring a meal from home thats warm and ready to go. Its small, doesnt take up alot of space and really does heat up food when you want to break for lunch. Have said that though you do have to give it time to warm up your food. I usaually plug it in as soon as i can before 9 am and my lunch is ready by 11 am or whenever its an appropriate time to have lunch. It warks really well with caned soups. I also suggest that you thaw out frizen dinners at home before you decide to use it otherwise youll wait awhile before its done, but it will get done! I do recommend that you also get the glass pyrex container thats for this warmer. It works better in my opinion heating your food evenly and thoroughly because it will heat up the glass.Since i did buy this warmer last year i bought it when this unit was $9.99 and now its at $39.99!!! so that is my reason for giving it 4 stars and not 5. Supply and demand i suppose... It has held up well and easy to clean but the price has gone up unfortunately but It is the smallest unit you can buy and WILL WORK!

Its a hotplate in a laminated tote made out of cloth, it works pretty good but takes awhile to heat up food, if ur foods cold its going to take a hour to dethaw and another hour to cook. It only reaches a certain temperature so u could even touch the service of the hotplate if u wanted and sadly the hotplate is made of plastic not metal, thats how they use plastic and the compatibility for on the go. It has no gauge to control temp just reset low heat. If anything get a hotplate for cheaper with more temperature control with a pyrex bowl and call it a day. This works since i bought it already but i live in my truck and only use 100ah. At 2 hours for every meal im using more electricity than a 500watt hotplate for 5-10 minutes

reviewTitle: Life changing for a truck driver
reviewDescription: I'm a truck driver and got tired of cold deli sandwiches and they few restaurants that i can park in.  This thing is the greatest thing I've ever bought for work. It doesn't burn food if you forget about it for a while.  I use glass container or plastic with no issue. Takes 1 to 2 hours to heat food up.  Any driver or someone who doesn't have access to microwave needs this. I've recommended it to guys at work.  If it broke today I'd buy another one immediately. Tip- watch the price,  it goes up and down from 30 to 40 bucks.  Buy it at 30.*update*After 8 months of near daily use, it has stopped working.  True to what I said in my original review,  I immediately purchased another one. This time though, i bought it from the hotlogic website directly so i could get the one year warrantyUpdate 2: I bought another one and it broke after two months. The others I bought lasted at least a year. Just past the return date. Should have taken my own advice and bought directly from hotlogic website. Deducting a star.

I bought it for my husband. To make his lunch or dinner hot. He loves it. It just takes 1/2 an hour to heat a 32 oz glass tiffin. The car charger which comes in it works good. Overall money well spent.I knocked one star down because the plastic tiffin which came with this lunch box was broken. I did not bother to return it. It was a disposable one. Not a big thing. But still seller has to keep that in mind for future sales.

reviewTitle: Great product that could be improved
reviewDescription: As a truck driver, I absolutely love this little oven. I use it everyday. Being able to have hot food on the road is awesome. It actually gets hot enough that I have to unplug it and let the food cool down for a bit.  I also found that the Rubbermaid long, low profile take alongs fit perfect inside. It's more durable than the container that comes with the product.That being said, the only issue I have with the product is the pocket for holding the cord. When you first unbox the oven, the cord is shoved in that pocket. But as I used it on a daily basis, folding and stuffing the cord back into the pocket for transport started to tear the lower stitching of the pocket. After about a month I started noticing a tear probably a 1/2 inch long. Now it is about two inches.It's really unfortunate this happens. I feel like the problem could be fixed with a reinforced stitching on the pocket to withstand the frequent in and out of the cord.But after all that, I would probably buy another one in the future. I would also recommend it to others with the caution that the pocket will probably tear.

I bought this for my husband to use at work. He had one with the plug in so I thought I would get him one for the truck too. He used it the other day for the first time and it wouldn’t heat at all. He even tried to different vehicles and they were running too. It’s past my 30 days do I can’t even return it
I bought this as a gift and I'm not sure I'll give it to them as the zipper is super cheap and sticks at the corners

Do not buy!!! My husband got this to warm his food at work.  It worked great for the first few months.  One day it stopped working as the plug melted.  We tried contacting the seller and got absolutely no response.  What a waste of money.  Please see pics.  Luckily nothing worse happened.
This thing was worthless, I can't believe they charge $50Its a hot plate inside a lunch bag.... I ended up buying an electric hot pot andam way happier with it

I got this for an emergency backup during hurricanes. First one zipper broke and then the other. They literally fall apart. Very cheap. I have not even used it to cook as I have had no power outages since I purchased it. Look for something sturdier than this.

reviewTitle: Not worth the buy, very disappointed.
reviewDescription: Stopped working after five uses. No longer word when I plug it into my work truck. The car port has power so it is a fault with the product.

reviewTitle: Stopped working after a short time of using smh
reviewDescription: I got it in July, didn’t use it for more than three months and it stopped working. I plug it to heat up my food and it would not heat up. I tried different vehicles to see if maybe it was just my car but no. Dead already. Waste of $40 😒

Never worked. Light turns on as if it’s working but the plate never got hot. It was plugged in for hours. Tried two different outlets. Nothing. First time using it. Unfortunately I didn’t use it till a couple months after ordering so it looks like I can’t return it so buyer beware. Check for faulty products right away when receiving.

The first time I used this lunch box it was fine. After 2 or 3 hours my lunch was warm not hot by any means. Went to use for the second time the zipper pull broke off. I tried to pull the zipper with my fingers after and the zipper shattered in my fingers.

I used this warmer daily for work and loved it . Recently I was using it and realized the 12v plug itself was so hot it actually was melting the plastic around it . The website says set and forget but I would use this product under supervision only .

It kept the food warm, but the plastic keeping the wires in came off while it was plugged in and now it has a bunch of loose wires. It’s fully broken and no longer works. I think it got too hot and possibly melted something in my car.Is a replacement even possible? If a replacement is an option I will have to keep a close eye on it when it’s plugged in to make sure it doesn’t come undone again.I bought this in the beginning of November and used it once or twice a week it broke mid March...

It had one job... Reheat stuff that would be bad for the microwave...I bought this for my hotel room with the idea that within an hour or 2, it'll reheat. I bought this a month ago and used it maybe once or twice... The third time I used it, it didn't work, and i made sure it worked or didn't by putting a different appliance in the same socket. I thought I was crazy, but after an hour, 2 hours, 3 hours, no heat.
