Warms the food good- I had a bowl of pasta and it heated up in about 30 min but the smell of it is horrible I hope will not smell like this every single time I use it

reviewTitle: The cord broke from the car plug in socket
reviewDescription: It was working beautifully until we pulled it from the car lighter socket and half stayed in the socket and cord broke off.

reviewTitle: This is a small lunchbox size
reviewDescription: I though it would be larger something you could take a casserole in, but it is not. It is lunch box size. I kept it and gave it as the gift. The person ended up returning it to me and said they would not use it. :-(
The only thing I don’t like about this item  that it  does not have  a pouch or something that I  can put my fork and napkins or spoon in
It worked when it worked!.  Stop working less than a year

My boyfriend LOVES this, he does landscaping and he’s a very hard worker and needs to eat properly with the amount he does. Sometimes he misses lunch and with that hurts his weight were he is so tiny!!! To ensure he is getting properly fed and getting a good meal this is has done wonders! He gets his favorite foods nice and hot! He was shocked how hot it got to heat it. It’s perfect size to flatten and put back in his backpack. Best part is no buttons no setting no remember to open the vent he can just plug in and walk away !!! And as to my surprise it came with its own container.The only flaw was the charger was difficult to out in it almost felt like it was gonna break not sure if it’s because it’s new or the vehicle. And yes it is a mini for sure and perfect to fit and a backpack that’s also a cooler but it’s maybe a little to small for me personally, only because I would prefer to pack a deeper dish for a huge lunch but he’s fine with it which that’s all that matters. Also don’t pack to much in the container where you can’t stir. I over did it and the top of the food was still cold even after 45 min and I didn’t leave room to stir. Other than that this is a great product a must have if you work outside. Great present idea for your husband boyfriend girlfriend whoever !

reviewTitle: Works perfectly for lunch heat up
reviewDescription: As a teacher with a strict 40-minute lunch period, I don't want to waste up to 10 minutes standing in line for the one microwave in the Teachers Room! This is the perfect solution! I'm not cooking food, just heating up. I plug it in around 8:30 a.m. and my lunch is at 11:45. Chilis, stews, and soups all reheat to the perfect temperature! And I get my microwave line time back!I don't carry this back and forth as my lunch bag since there are things in there I don't want to be heated up. I just take out my container when I get to school, put it in the Hot Logic, and plug it in.The only con I see is that the zipper doesn't open smoothly. I have to put a finger in and lift up the top of the bag around the corners. I hope the zipper lasts! So, 4 stars instead of 5 for that reason.

The hot bag works ok for precooked meals. I’ve never tried to cook raw meats in it as it claims you can do however. Prepackaged meals like healthy choice need to be tired or you get a burn spot on the bottom. Yes you CAN have them in too long. Any of those with the cardboard type bowl burn horribly and are very dry.Soups, canned ravioli etc and home cooked meals do very well.Keep in mind the temps are over 180 degrees so the longer it heats the dryer things can get.It definitely does the job and heats food well. It even came with a nice sealable food tray for. Home cooked meals. Saved more in the first week the. This device cost. Highly recommend
Esata bonita lo malo que solo se puede conectar al carro para calentar

reviewTitle: My husband had really enjoyed hot lunches
reviewDescription: My husband is a local cdl driver and for months he had been eating cold lunches because I couldn’t find a “easy” heating method. But recently I came across this lunch bag and it’s done great! 20-30 minutes to warm up cooked food - my hubs eats a lot of meat so I do recommend slightly undercooking meats so when they heat up they have a chance to keep some moisture.The thing I like about this the most is it’s plug n go. My husband doesn’t have to fuss with it to get it working.The only thing that would improve this bag is to have a small section on the top to add snacks (cheese, small cracker packs, etc) or side pouch to stick a single can drink in.

reviewTitle: Its good for warming up food. Not cooking it
reviewDescription: It does not replace a microwave or stove AT ALL. If you're expecting to cook anything on it expect to be there for hours because it pretty slow to warm up to that point. However it does keep food warm and can warm up room temperature/cold food for however long you need it to. But its not gonna get fry an egg on it hot. I don't regret buying it as it has helped me in alot of situations. Oh and it has certain spots that are hotter than others. I like thst you only have to plug it in and easyness of it.

reviewTitle: Really awesome if you're trying so hard not to use a microwave and traveling with food.
reviewDescription: I really love this! It's easy to keep clean! I feel it's really safe to use! but my only issue is the food smells fill the air so close quarters in the car traveling only works if it's not a onion based meal.

reviewTitle: Great for heating good on the go!
reviewDescription: Awesome product, great for cooking a hot meal. As a truck driver I use daily to heat up breakfast Sandwiches and meal prep items for lunch.(Cons)The seem to have a short lifespan when used regularly. My second one lasted only 2 months.

Perfect size, fits most meal prep containers and works great. Never have to wait in line to use office microwave anymore so two thumbs up.Not a deal breaker for me but the lid to the container that came with the product broke because of the packaging so just a heads up for the next person.

This is the first time I have bought something like this and its amazing. My husband is used to working in an office with all the amenities needed for lunch breaks. Now ge is out in the cold working and his lunches just dont stay warm. I've bought him soup thermos's but he still is getting luke warm meals at best. I started searching for appliances that can be heated by car lighters and this one popped up. I read the reviews and thought I'd give it a try. He's had it out 2 days now and at luch time he sends me texts say OMG THANK YOU for this thing. His food was so hot that he had to blow on it before taking a bite.The only reason I am giving it a 4 star is the zipper is cheap and I see it becoming an issue in time but I've already thought that out. He can use chip bag clamps to keep it shut.My suggestion for the company is to make a bigger one with a quality zipper. My husband has only used the plastic container it came with but he will be using pyrex glass dishes this week with sealed lids to prevent spillage.Tammy

I just received my product with the paisley design,12v. On my initial view, it seems quickly and cheaply made.  Color / pattern  didn't scream paisley with deep rich colors. Some  stitching bunches slightly.  The zipper doesn't glide easily and one of the pull tags was bent. Not a one handed zip.  When zipped, one area is bowed which could be a stitching issue.  Thanks for the plastic to go container that I bent (lid) while trying to reshape the product.  I so want to love this item.  Not confident it is sturdy enough to last while on the road.  I will return with another review once it is used.  Just wondering if an AC plug could have been included for home use.
Recibí el producto y puedo evidenciar que la cremallera es de muy mala calidad. Creo que no durará mucho.

reviewTitle: Stopped working after 2 weeks of purchase
reviewDescription: I used this to keep my prepared meals warm in the car because my job requires lot of driving. The product worked fine at the beginning but it stopped warming after about 2 weeks. I thought it was something wrong with my car’s port, but it tuned out that the product just stopped working for no reason
Zippers are flimsy, have to be careful zipping around the corners or it’ll get caught on the material inside. Kind of disappointed in overall quality for the price.

I like the product because it warm up my leftover food. My food container was placed in Hotlogic around 1045am and was taken out around 1250. By the way this was my first time using it....When it was opened I saw the condensation on the inside of the container and thought wow! It worked!What I dislike about it was it only made my food warm. Maybe I should have it in a little longer than 2 hrs but I was hungry. It's an okay buy. Just remember it's not a microwave.

reviewTitle: Worked well until it didn’t work at all
reviewDescription: Had this for about 2 weeks and got about a dozen uses out of it before it completely didn’t work. I always kept cords organized and took good care of it but I guess it just couldn’t keep up

This is a handy device, but it's disappointing that it doesn't last long. After less than a year, using it about twice per week, the small spring in the plug broke. I bought a second unit, which now refuses to heat up after about ten months of use. I am debating buying a third. I guess it is worth $39 per year to warm my lunch in the truck.

reviewTitle: Works great, zipper doesn’t - zipper is of poor quality
reviewDescription: I love the product idea and it heats fast.I did not like the zipper on the container, it could and should be more durable.  It’s gets stuck and is very hard to zip.It seems to me, that it will not last long.  It’s no good if the zipper breaks because the heat will escape.

My boyfriend works in construction and is always eating a cold lunch, I bought this for him in hope he’ll finally be able to eat a hot lunch on the jobsite. He uses plastic meal prep containers so that was my first concern, is that it would melt the plastic. The description states its safe for plastic containers, it wont melt them. His first time using it, it melted the bottom of the container. He even tried using the container it came with and it also melted the bottom. He figured out plugging it in and letting it sit a little before putting his food in kinda helped so in that sense its been working fine. It also says you can heat frozen foods in a cardboard container, he wanted to try it out. It ended up getting so hot it melted the bag and started smoking. When it worked, it was great he loved it.
I’ve bought two of these. Both lasted less than a year before they stopped working. Shame because they work well when they’re working.

I purchased this for my husband since he is out all day driving around in his truck and is far from home. He always complained about his food being cold and he would choose to eat out at times because he wanted a warm meal. I want him to eat healthy so I bought this for him and he absolutely loves it. He plugs it in his truck about 1 hour before lunch and he gets to have a hot meal :) I absolutely  recommend this!Unfortunately after a few uses the zipper on the bag broke and it seems to be falling apart :(

reviewTitle: Loved it, but stopped working after 4 months
reviewDescription: Loved it, but it stopped working after 4 months. It heated up really fast and I had these awesome warm meals when working on the road. But then for no apparent reason it stopped working -- no liquid damage, nothing visibly wrong with the cord, didn't experience any trauma. Tested it in several different cars to be sure. Really disappointing for the price. If I buy again, I will probably go with the cheaper knockoff ones.
It was smaller than I thought, my friend had one and I liked the size of hers. I don't know how good this item worked as I returned it, but it looked perfect and I'm sure it would be great.
Haven't tried this yet but disappointing that the container it came with was broken upon opening.

I bought this item on September 11 2020. It quit working on October 30. The return window with Amazon closed on October 15. I contacted Hotlogic about this on October 30 and have gotten nothing but a run around. I will not buy another Hotlogic product. On about November 23 I received a replacement from Hotlogic, it is working good at this time.
Loved this mini oven as long it worked. Had it for 18 month and just used it during the winter months and now it's not heating up anymore. Little disappointed, thought it will last longer :-(

I wish it was maybe twice the size. Kinda hard to put anything in there that's maybe bigger than a handful of hot dogs. Warmth was fine, but the distribution of heat was a bit of a problem. Just turned out to be very underwhelming. As a concept, I love the idea, but I think I'll upgrade to something more heavy duty.

reviewTitle: after only a few uses the surface started to peel while cleaning
reviewDescription: I like the fact that it heats food evenly and easily. however after only a few uses as I was cleaning the surface it started to peel. I did to have leftover food sitting on it. I cleaned it up immediately after using once it had cooled so its not like I was trying to scrape off anything.

Had it for about 3 months. It was working great until it stopped working. The little end piece of the plug came off and I can no longer use it. It’s good for a short period of time, but if you’re looking for a long term use, spend a little more on a better product.

reviewTitle: Small, slow, but it does what it promises
reviewDescription: The portable oven does what it promises. It is small and you can only get a handful of containers to fit in it, but if you look, you can find them.The key to operating this item is not to unzip it while it is warming up the food. Also, depending on what you are heating up or what thickness of food container you have at the moment, it might increase the heating time to 75 minutes. So if you are a fly-by-the-seat-of-your-pants when it comes to eating your lunch, this will not work for you at all.Overall, I am glad there is an item that allows me to avoid microwaving my food.
Wish I could use it..plug doesn't fit in my older vehicle cigarette outlet..so I can't tell how it is..like all the other reviews, though..(everyone else must have newer cars).

reviewTitle: Only lasted less than a year
reviewDescription: It was great while it lasted but needing to spend $40 in less than a year is ridiculous. The shelf life should be longer for this product.
A bit tight, depends on what you place inside it will approximately take 35 to 45 mins to heat up. But otherwise very practicle.

I have a less expensive Skywin portable oven and was hoping to upgrade after reading reviews. The HotLogic came with a plastic fast food container! The Skywin has a metal cooking pan and a plastic lid that is a better quality. This is going back!
Kept food warm, but too small for much more than a sandwich.

reviewTitle: This worked great for about 8 uses.  Then it stopped working.
reviewDescription: Not sure why it stopped working.  I checked for a short in the power line.  Couldn't find one.  There were no loose wires.  It stopped after about 8 uses.
The heat takes forever a good hour for food to get warm and hour n a half for to be hot. But it does work it just needs time
Purchased Used-Like New. Arrived in an undamaged shipping box, but plastic container was cracked, and zipper was defective.

reviewTitle: Be safe! Check food temperature before eating!
reviewDescription: For frozen pre-packaged meals to be safe, they must be heated throughout to a min of 165F/74C for a period of several minutes. I've had mixed results with the HOTLOGIC Warming Tote. A rectangular foil or 'microwave safe' plastic container that covers most of the warming element in the Tote works best, but after a min of 2 hours in the Tote, my meals have varied from 150F/65C to 180F/82C. Most of the time the temperature has been below the safety threshold. Oddly, refrigerated left-overs have heated to a lower temperature than frozen meals! I have access to a microwave that can bring my food to the correct temp, but what is the point of using this Warming Tote if a microwave is still necessary?I really WANT to like this Tote. A friend raved about it, and when office access to microwaves was limited by the pandemic, it seemed like a fantastic find. Just make sure your food is the proper temperature before consuming.

reviewTitle: Good product. But broke with less than one year usage.
reviewDescription: Ok first off. I love this product!!! I used it around 4 times a week for almost a year. I work in the transportation industry where a hot meal isnt always practical. But this changed everything!!! I probably turned 20 people onto this little gem . However just last week it stopped working. So while i do feel i got my monies worth out of the item.... I just cant give it five stars as I would have like it to last a little longer.Also here are some of the best ways I have come to use this container wise....Dollar tree -- Three individual foil containers for a buck. Good but you have to be carefull of steam as they so not seal 100%.Glass pyrex -- Ok but very heavy. This is a hugh minus... If you are not returning home everyday. Also the lid will pop off slightly if you heat for a while.The Best option by FAR!!!!IKEA ceramic/plastic container with a lid that has pressure release built in. This was awesome it was a little bigger than the pyrex so you kind of have to pull the corners around the container but it works flawlessly. Completely water tight and very lightweight.
I wanted a more healthier way to heat up my lunch and this has surpassed my expectations. I high recommend everyone to purchase it for yourself. I don’t travel without it!!

So what you see here is baked jerk Chicken, Mac & Cheese with some Cabbage Collard Greens 🥬 mix..If you’re going on the road for a long drive & wanna eat when you get there then this is perfect!Plug it in the car charger for about an hour for piping hot food & a little longer if you took the leftovers from the fridge..I’m an Over the road driver (OTR) Motor Coach Operator & this is THEEEEEE BEST!! Yep for you Truckers too !!When you heat up your food made from home & open it up steamy hot is comforting..It comes with a plastic container but I suggest getting the suggested Pyrex glass dish, glass is always better.

I got this for my boyfriend who works on a construction site and does not have access to a microwave. We have had it for a few months now and he absolutely loves it! It works great and now he can take left overs from dinner the night before. It has been super beneficial during these cold months so he is able to have a hot meal on his lunch break. It has also given him so much more options of what he can take to eat. It’s also super easy to use and heats up the food great. I would definitely recommend to anyone who does not have access to a microwave at work but does have access to a place to plug it in.

Bought this for my husband and brother for work. They love the convenience of being able to heat up their lunch/food when on the road and at work. Ideal for truckers on the road… I’m a repeat customer because this has been our go-to brand for this product. Highly recommend!

I hate that it takes 2hrs to heat up a frozen meal,  but I do like the fact that if I ever go somewhere with no microwave,  then this works just fine.  (I only tried it once). I'm gonna see how long it takes to just warm up some leftovers.  I do like it.  This is something I can take to work and heat my food up while I'm working and by lunch time it will be ready. (I get breaks every 2hrs, so it will be heating up for only 2hrs).
I bought one for at Christmas for my husband.  Several of the men that he works with all wanted one. They all love it.

reviewTitle: It works. Very well at that. No more fast food.
reviewDescription: This thing rules. I no longer need to eat fast food on the road or sandwiches from home. I can make a half decent healthy meal and bring it with me. The bag is insulated they state it’ll last 12 hours keeping things warm. I don’t know how true that is, but I can tell you at an hour and five minutes and needed a little bit more time. It was hot but not as hot as I would like it after an hour and a half it was perfect. It came with a Chinese food container that is plastic. I bought a Pyrex  From Amazon that fits perfectly as you see my video. I’ll update my review as time goes on. This thing is definitely worth its weight and gold.

It’s cute, not huge and bulky, fits a plate of food perfectly on the hot mat. I haven’t had any issues with leakage or over heating/getting too hot on the outside. My job doesn’t really allow me time to stop, but food and sit and eat when I want so with this I’m able to plug it into the rig and by the time I’m done with a call I have a nice hot meal I can eat before getting another call.

I've had my HotLogic for over 6 years and it's still one of my favorite gadgets. I keep it in my desk drawer at work and use it to heat up lunch. When I get to work, I put my lunch container straight into the HotLogic so that whenever I can break for lunch, it's ready. I will say I did have to put a folded paper towel on the heating element because once I did have a (albeit cheap) plastic container melt just enough to stick. The folded paper towel resolved that and hasn't been an issue since.

reviewTitle: Keeps Food Hot in My Delivery Bag!
reviewDescription: I bought the pink because it was the cheapest one, it goes inside my catering bag and stays between 180°-200° F and won’t melt styrofoam packaging or plastic bags used by many fast food and dine in restaurants. It’s a game changer when there are a lot of orders and traffic is bad, or I messed up and took that GrubHub order and it didn’t come close to where I thought it was going, adding heat ensures the customer gets hot food without adding enough heat to change the cooking levels. Five stars so far, it works well so fsr.UPDATED 04/07/23I’ve found that when I start my deliveries I plug this in gaily l to the multi cigarette lighter adapter I use, and open the insulated bag of this lunchbox fully, I can insert the entire thing into my 3 year old small DD bag that’s looking ratty on the outside, but the foil insulation inside is still perfect. This allows the foil inside the old DD bag to heat up, and it can’t contain all the the heat, so rather than having a single hot spot that’s 8 x 10 or so, it spreads the heat evenly throughout the catering bag after these two bags go inside of the catering bag to keep it ALL warm. I’m thinking about cutting the bottom of the old DD bag out to allow heat to escape more evenly. I’ll probably also cut slits in the sides to even it all out. I’ll keep anyone interested posted on my results in the coming week or two.

Even though we verified it is compatible with our vehicle it gets tooooo hot even after 30 mins of run time. This issue started about 5 weeks after we been using the item 3-4 days a week. Would love a replacement but we are outside the 30 day return window.

It's decent. Very underpowered. I'm a driver, and I started putting my food in to heat 1.5 hours before lunch. Even then, it gets warm, but not HOT. It's definitely better than eating cold, but also not as hot as you'd like it.It also varies depending on the food. My rice bowls with ground meat heat up decently in 1.5 hours, but chicken breats(diced) or anything thicker is pretty Luke warm after the same time.I'll probably try and heat it up for 2+ hours, see if that makes a difference. But it's a bit annoying having to heat food for that much time to be hot. Might just look into getting another brand.

reviewTitle: So so. Would not but again
reviewDescription: Works great. But the life of it was not very long.

reviewTitle: Love it but should automatically shut off
reviewDescription: It doesn’t over heat or burn the surface it’s sitting on (well I haven’t experienced it) but it just stays on as long as it’s plugged in. I just feel like there should be an auto shut off for safety purposes. But it definitely heats up some food and it taste 10 times better than the microwave. It’s not going to give you oven quality reheats but it comes pretty dang close

Sort of a disappointment. As a flight attendant, we've been using these for years. So I still have 2 others. The colors aren't as bright on the case, which is the reason to get this colorful style. The zipper has been swapped out for a cheaper version, so hopefully that will last through multiple uses. And the biggest disappointment, the no longer come with a heavy glass bakeware container and top. Now it's just a cheap black hopefully resuable container with a plastic top. i can't imagine how few travels this will last. Thank goodness I saved my other units so I can just swap it out. But most people will have to buy the durable glass, reusable bakeware. But, I'm going to make it work.

reviewTitle: Not durable and element gets hot
reviewDescription: I recently purchased this for my trip. Used it 4 times. I like it, It is handy and does heat up fast. I have to watch because the temperature is always high within 15 mins.  Though the inside sides of the pouch looks like aluminum, I don’t understand how the bag can start to melt n wrinkle. Also they claim you can put plastic in it, I tried putting the food in the plastic container that came with the pouch and after one use it is already melted a little. I was kind of disappointed with this as I had wanted to purchase another one after trying this. But I don’t think I would. I hope this review is published. I saw the reviews and because of the good reviews, I bought this product.
I use this to keep tortilla’s warm at the table.But the zipper. Is cheap, hangs up and doesn’t open or close smoothly.Velcro would have been a better choice, imo.
Catching flies. Works but not at rate the add shows. Bate was not specified.I had to trim the fly ended hole, it was covered with some netting.

Seems to work just fine, but I had to go out and purchase another container as the one that it came with was smashed and broken. I was upset (especially for the price) but I needed it right asap so I couldn't return for another. Wish is was sturdier so that I won't run the chance of it getting smashed again.

I'm a truck driver and it's hard to find a microwave on the road. This item has came in handy so many times. Heats the food up perfectly I've only used plastic and glass Tupperware. Plastic is the quickest to heat up. My only 2 complaints is that I'm on my 3rd one in the last 2 years. They are cheaply made.  First one the plug melted. Second one one of the zippers broke but I still had the other. Then the other one broke.Let's hope this 3rd one lasts longer.I use this item about twice a day 5 days a week.

reviewTitle: Drains power from vehicle, and doesn’t reheat precooked food very well.
reviewDescription: Not good for reheating already cooked foods on the road..doesn’t do well with glass dishes either. The bottom gets VERY hot and then the food never actually warms. I wanted it to heat my food quickly for when I’m ready to eat, but this is one of those “plug it in at the beginning of the day, and it’ll be warmish by lunch time” type of deals. Also my fiancé’s work vehicle started very rough while using this..so it’s draining tons of power from the battery, with less than desirable results. Wouldn’t recommend. Going to return.

reviewTitle: Plate came broken,  if its sent via bag, be aware of damage.
reviewDescription: Plastic Tupperware is not sturdy, came in damaged,  I'm a Truck driver on road for long periods,  don't have time to return, so having to bite the bullet.Just be aware it can arrive damaged so plan ahead with extra bowls. I didn't purchase bowls hence I was testing product prior to investing.
Christmas gift. My uncle loved it, it’s January 4 and as of Monday it stopped working. I barely missed the window to return. I’m very disappointed and sad for him because he loved it. Not durable.

I purchased this for my husband as a Father's Day gift. He is a truck driver and was just sick of taking sandwiches for lunch and wanted the option to have a hot meal. It worked great for the 3 times he got to use it last week. He plugged it in this morning and the light came on. He pulled out his lunch on his break and it was still ice cold....The concept is great and it did in fact work really well when used it. Just didn't last long at all!
The idea is good. However, you have to wait for about 10 mins until the food is warmed up which is a downside comparing the speed of the microwave.

This is sooo much better than a microwave! It took about 30 minutes to reheat packaged food that I bought. It uses very little electricity. Everyone needs to have one of these.I bought this on July 5, 2022 and have used it everyday. Now it has an electrical burning smell. I am so disappointed!

Bought this because I am a truck driver that is on a dedicated run. I put my food in about an hour before I'm going to take my 30 min Lunch/Break. It gets the food warm enough to melt cheese. There isn't any temp control it reminds me of a crock pot on low. The size is perfect for the lunch size Rubbermaid containers. I had one that lasted me 2 years with daily use. The solder came loose on the plug. I ordered a second and it only lasted 4 months. The tip of the plug came off.

We were really excited about this product, up until the plug for the car melted and stopped working. Really disappointed with the quality of the product, idea is great but the quality was really poor. Not sure if we got a defective piece and thus did not lasted, but it’s too late for a return. Perhaps it’ll be better to use a USB adapter but the plug broke so fast.  Please take a moment to reevaluate the purchase if you’re looking for something of good quality.

I bought this because I am a person that work out of a truck, having that said I needed something that could warm up my lunches to save some moneyDoes it do it ?In a way yes but it take forever to do so, I have had it hooked up for 30 minutes and still not gotten my food hot only warm after 45 mins it made it hot.I only get a 20-30 minute lunchSo if you have a lot more time then this could work

reviewTitle: Worked great but has durability issues
reviewDescription: At first this was fantastic. I saved a lot of money from not having to eat out. This work great and warmed food perfectly. The issue is the durability. I used the one that plugs into the cigarette lighter. There is no on/off switch so you have to unplug it every time. In less then a year the inside of the plug pulled apart.  I used this almost everyday but I still think it should have lasted longer
Bought as a gift for a railroader. He hasn’t received it yet.

I’m often driving around at work during lunch time and I can’t afford to buy lunch/dinner every day so I decided to meal prep each week. Only problem was, where do I heat up my food? Sometimes there’s an office or 711 nearby but often enough there’s nothing so I had the option to eat it cold or wait until I could find a microwave. I found this lunchbox on Amazon and figured, what the heck for this low price I’ll give it a shot. It’s the best purchase! On the downside, yes the box takes a bit to heat up depending on what the food is it could be a 30 minute wait or an hour. On the bright side , I usually eat around the same time each night so I plug it in an hour early and by the time I’m hungry my food is hot and ready to go ! It’s very small and light so easily fits into my bag without a hassle. I’d highly recommend this to others !

reviewTitle: A nice addition to my office tools during COVID
reviewDescription: Like many who have jobs that cannot be performed from home, I have been relying on work to provide a microwave in the break room.  Ours has three of them which are continually being used simultaneously causing the electric circuit they run on to overload and blow a fuse.  That normally takes us down to one oven which is covered with everyone's lunch because it's too much to ask for consideration these days when personal convenience dominates over all.Enter the Hot Logic food warming tote.  It's very light and so compact, it arrived in a shipping bag like clothing rather than in a box which surprised me.  It's just a standard aluminum lined canvas tote with a little hot plate built into it.  Just enclose your lunch inside and plug it in.  It's plenty hot from a frozen state in an hour.  I've heated a Trader Joe's spinach lasagne, a Jon's mac and cheese and a Deep Indian Spinach Paneer (all frozen grocery items) and all came out perfectly heated.  That's one less trip to the break room and less handling of door knobs and community appliances in the safety of my office.
I had one of these in the past but lost it. I decided to buy another and am just as happy with this as before. Great purchase!
For the most part everything is good but to me it's a little to small to put multiple containers of food in there. Gotta put one container at a time based on how big it is.

My husband has enjoyed being able to have a hot meal at work. He doesn't always have access to a microwave so this is a great alternative. He does have to turn it on pretty early before lunch to get things going. The container that comes with was broke when it arrived but its just a cheap one so didn't really care.
Keep my food warm and easy to carry, can fit in my purse

I just got this unit and ran my first test. It's a little smaller than I thought it would be, but no biggie for me.I re-heated a left over soup directly out of the fridge, put in a sauce pan, took the element out of the container and placed it on the counter top and plugged it in.From cold soup to hot soup in 90 minutes! Very nice!I then left the pot on the element for another hour, and the soup was piping hot! Almost too hot to eat!More tests to come with my Jackery and Stanely power boxes!
It works well, actually warms much quicker than 4 hours than stated in some reviews, but smaller than I thought.
got this for my son that drives a school bus he say it works really well

reviewTitle: Love the product but it failed in 6 weeks.
reviewDescription: I have very mixed feelings about this product. On the plus side the warming tote was compact and light weight yet held enough food for a full meal. It was simple to use and most importantly the food warned up as promised and tasted great! As an example, I had some ribs left over from the previous day. I just wrapped them in parchment paper, plugged in the tote and then pulled my van over in about 45 minutes to eat. They were as moist and delicious as the day before.Unfortunately, after 45 days the tip of the plug came off and I can no longer use the product. It's past Amazon's 30 day return policy so I'm very disappointed. The product is great but the durability didn't work out for me.
Purchased this in mid January. Has already stopped working less than 3 months. Waste of money.

reviewTitle: I received it today and the inside container are broken
reviewDescription: Not happy at all the inside container was broken. Not recommended.
Sadly the products plug was not for an electric outlet so I will be returning.
Used Hot Logic on kitchen counter max of 5 times and stitching failing  and zipper failing. Do not waste your money!

reviewTitle: Stopped working after a few months.
reviewDescription: Worked great for a few months and then stopped working. It was probably used no more than 12 times.  Short lifespan.

I’ve had the product for two months and it was great, up until today. I plugged it in like I always do and waited for my food to warm up. 5 minutes into warming up my food I started to smell an odor, which I didn’t think much about because I thought it was the bowl the food was in. When I went to unplug it I did so without looking and burned my finger badly. The plug completely melted and became extremely hot.I plugged in my phone charger just to make sure it wasn’t the outlet. No issuesWhen it worked it was great, but now I have burnt finger, an unusable item, cold food. Thankfully a fire wasn’t started.

Trash! I was obsessed with it at first. Then 3 months later it stopped working. I emailed them requesting a new plate. They sent it quickly. Plugged it in and the very first time it wouldn’t turn on. Don’t waste your money!

My friend has this item from overstock.com. Hers came with a nice glass dish for heating. Mine from Amazon came with a cheap plastic container much like a take out box. If I had known this, I would NOT have bought from AmazonUPDATE:  I emailed Hot Logic and expressed my frustration with the plastic dish. Anna Hollar contacted me immediately to work on a solution. To my surprise, she offered to send a replacement glass dish for heating foods, at no cost to me.  This type of customer service is hard to find.  To say I will purchase more of their items in the future is positively true.  They have made me a customer for life.

Order 2 one for my lady an one for myself. 1 works fine.  The other one takes forever to heat up. I can't just return one cause of how the system works. I don't want to return the good one. An because I  can't return the bad one without returning both I can't give thus company a good review. Order 2 a 1 doesn't work.  That's not good

reviewTitle: The bag does not feel good quuality
reviewDescription: Outer bag (I got purple) is flimsy, and the black trim was seamed together cheaply.  The seam is fraying and gets stuck in the zipper and it's brand new.

For me this was a great discovery.  These should be advertised more at high school and college.  As a Vegan I have difficulty finding adequate meals when I have to travel.  I used this on a recent business trip and was impressed. Some of what I "cooked" was a test to find out if it worked and I was not disappointed.  One morning I quartered some amber potatoes, spiced them, place in a container with a few tablespoons of water and when I came back for dinner four hours later (after work) the potatoes were done exactly as they should have been. i did pasta, vegetables, frozen pizza, frozen desert, and a few other items.  They all cooked exactly as they should have.  This is so small, easy to pack, doesn't burn food, and the meal is ready when one returns from work.  Sorry it took me so long to find the product.
I purchased in January and by June the hot plate stopped working, I used it maybe 20 times. I contacted the company and the promptly sent a replacement hot plate. It keeps food nice and hot.

this is good for on the go when you have time to wait for your food other than that it takes a while for food to heat completely up. I haven't tried cooking with this, but I would imagine it would take some time if you like your food well cooked.
Bag and zipper feel a little cheap to be honest but it gets the job done ✅
Perfect for truck drivers like myself . Keeps your good hot all day until you’re ready to eat.

All I have to say about this warmer is it works great.  I have always wanted something to warm my lunch and a friend told me about this product and I bought one love it. The only reason I gave it a 4 Star is because it takes a little time to get your food ready. It doesn’t get it Kitchen hot but it gets it pretty close. Great product!

Nice to have to be able to heat something up away from a stove/microwave. Pretty ideal if you are in a hotel w/o any amenities. Ive heated a few things, frozen (pre-cooked) chicken, pasta dish, leftover thai food and all suffer the same problem.. soggy and too much water absorption. the pasta and thai both wound up too saturated? with water, very mushy/overcooked unlike the original prep. Not sure if there is anything that can be done about that. The chicken was soggy too. I am sure there are some things it reheats great, I just havent found them yet.

reviewTitle: Takes time but saves searching for a microwave!
reviewDescription: Im a flight attendant so love the idea of having a way to heat up my meals after a long day of flying. Not all of the hotels provide microwaves and it’s not in my budget to buy meals every night I travel. It does take some time to heat up food (allow an hour at least!) so if you’re looking for a quick meal this is not the gadget for you. (This is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5) I bring my food already in the glass container I’ll be using (instead of trying to transfer it from foil, etc, to the container.) As soon as I get in my room I plug it in. By the time I get settled in, it’s usualy only about a 15-20 minute wait. So if you have the time to wait it’s totally worth it plus it’s safer than a microwave with the added plus of being green!

When I received the package and looked it over, it is missing a tooth on the zipper. A bit frustrating, but I will live with it as I don’t want to hassle with returning it. As for functionality, I give it 5 stars.
Not able to heat rice or bread. It takes 5-10 mins to wam, also not enough to feel the rice as warm.

I bought this for my dad since he is a truck driver and he loves it. I bought it in June, it is now the end of July and it stopped working. I highly recommend purchasing the protection plan because you will need it!
Product worked perfectly for 2 months and then just stopped heating completely! I only used it about 4 days a week so it's not like it was overworked.

reviewTitle: I want one that plugs into the power in the car,  not electric.
reviewDescription: I returned this item because it isn’t what I want,  you sent another one just like it and I have not ordered the other one yet
The container that comes inside came broken. Asked for a replacement and that one also came broken. You will have to find a container that fits inside.
Very disappointed.  Bought this for my dad and it’s already stopped working for him. He’s basically used it for three months. Will not heat.

We ordered this a year ago and itJust stopped working. Pretty frustrating that it didn’t last past a year. We really liked it- made traveling with food convenient, it worked just like it said- but guess longevity is an issue.... 👎🏻👎🏻
After only 5 months of use it is no longer working. I was satisfied how it worked but am very unsatisfied with the fact that it only worked for 5 months. Would like a return or exchange.

reviewTitle: It takes more tgan an hour to warm up food
reviewDescription: It takes way too long to warm up food

I love the idea.  It worked two times.  Those two times were great.  Will not even get warm now.  I have tried various plugs, the connection etc.  etc.  Still nothing!!  Very disappointed.  I keep hoping it will work.  🙁

reviewTitle: A Star for 2 months.....then it died.
reviewDescription: Worked for 2 months great and now it's dead. It heated up great when it worked but the cable plug does not work anymore. My trucker hubby now left without his portable oven. Really disappointed. I had high hopes for this one.

reviewTitle: Takes too long to heat up
reviewDescription: Husband is a pilot and many rooms no longer have microwaves. This was a great idea but disappointing as it takes an hour to warmup. Useless when u arrive late at night and still need to eat.

reviewTitle: Taking so much time to warm a food
reviewDescription: I could have brought a 120V. This warmer is very slow to warm up the food. This is suitable in long drive travels only.

The booklet enclosed with the unit indicates a warming temperature of 165 degrees.  The unit I received warmed a thawed veggie burger to 77 degrees after one hour.  An egg was runny after 30 minutes.  Kept it on the warmer for another half-hour, it was finally soft-cooked.
Ordered this in February for my husband and it already stopped working.  He loved it but with a 3 month time it,  it's not worth it. Disappointing for sure. I don't recommend.

reviewTitle: The electronic portion of this product is poorly designed
reviewDescription: Bought this a few months back and have only used it about 4 times so far.  Went to plug it into my car and the damn tip broke off. This product is so poorly made. I would not recommend it AT ALL
I bought this item in October 2021 and the Hot Logic didn’t even last 5 months. I hv to get myself a different brand
This lunchbox worked great for my boyfriend for a while and then one day the adapter literally just melted. It was really weird and now it is unusable. We’ve had it less than a year :(
It appeared much larger than it actually is. It’s the size of a personal lunch box. Not what I expected. Was hoping I could put a casserole in it. Nope.

reviewTitle: got a few uses out of it before it died completely
reviewDescription: Not super dependable
